website_summaries.verdict: Precise functionality that ensures you lock in on the target every time. Fits comfortably in your hand.
pros: Can toggle between slope and non-slope modes, all of which are USGA-legal
Waterproof features deal with tough course conditions
Uses vibration to indicate it has locked in on the target
cons: Reaction time of rangefinder is a little slow at times

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this range finder. Takes multiple attempts to locate the flag. If it is an elevated green and only a portion of get flag is visible you can forget about this range finder locating the flag. Anything outside of 200 yards it will not give you a distance. Unfortunately, i held onto it longer than 30 days and now I’m stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Freeman

customer_reviews.title: It works.........sometimes
customer_reviews.text: I have only used GPS range finders until I got this for Christmas. The NX7 Pro is very inconsistent. I can shoot the flag from say 150 yards out and it comes back with 3 different yardage numbers, none of them the same value. They are as much as 30-40 yards different. Not sure if its the cold weather it doesn't like or not but it's extremely frustrating that the NX7 Pro can't come up with a solution. I've attempted to contact customer service and all my concerns have fell on "deaf ears" Hopefully I just got a lemon but we'll see. My buddies Bushnell works all the time without the inconsistencies.
customer_reviews.author: Whoopsadaisy

customer_reviews.title: So the worse case scenario
customer_reviews.text: The Precision Pro Golf NX7 works well with a few exceptions. If it is windy, sometimes it's tough to "hone in" and get an accurate measurement. I have friend that use a competing range finder and the wind does not seem to bother it. So the worse case scenario, I have to take multiple readings to get a consensus. This is also happens when there is a lot going on behind the flag or green, like a heavily treed area. Other than that, it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problems at longer distances
customer_reviews.text: I have used the rangefinder for one month. A buddy of mine also purchased one. Mine will not read our provide distances over 170 yards, even though buddy's works flawlessly. I may have received a defective unit, but my return window closed yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L Barnes

customer_reviews.title: A great Rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: My first rangefinder. I researched them all. The Precision Pro NX7 with slope had great reviews. I liked the price and the features. Especially the slope feature. Used it in North Carolina on a golf trip for the first time. Took a bit of practice to hold it steady to to shoot the pin. Didn’t take too many times to get it right. The Slope feature was interesting to see the difference in distance on May of the holes with elevation changes. Loved the unit and felt it cut a couple of strokes off my score.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I was told about this range finder and how it was good so I bought it. I’m an old college golfer and golf champ and Idaho state champ that lives in Cali now. Since buying this I’ve had to aim high about 5 ft above pin. Most of the time it doesn’t lock unless I’m within a 150 yards. My old bushnell 1600 that’s 11 years old has better luck. I’ve tried contacting seller with no response. Really bummed out that this thing isn’t working. My buddies who has the same one seems to work better so idk.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nagelmann

customer_reviews.title: Good Performer
customer_reviews.text: This unit, is one of the few affordable ones that also measures the slope factor. Unit is small, light and comfortable to grip. Measurements have been extremely more accurate than GPS watches and handhelds as they normally just measure to the center of the green. This unit gives you extremely accurate readings. Its also fun to use. Support is great as there is a an office in FL, as opposed to China. When you call you get real USA support. Also recommend picking up the Frogger strap set available on Amazon as well. This will allow you to attach it to a golf cat frame or your bag. Am extremely happy with this product after having used comparable ones.
customer_reviews.author: Cascade545

customer_reviews.title: Takes a few tries but it's accurate and works.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it's very lightweight but doesn't feel flimsy. As expected for this price range, it doesn't give back the yardage as easily and quick as the Bushnell. On occasion, you have to give it a couple of tries to get the numbers. 10 seconds was the longest I've spent on retries to get the yardage. You get what you pay for. You want the yardage with slope on the first try then spend the extra $130 and get the Bushnell.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGeng

customer_reviews.title: This range finder is very good on the golf course
customer_reviews.text: This range finder is very good on the golf course. I like the vibration feature when it locks onto the flag or target. Its very quick...locks almost immediately after you press the button one time. The only improvement I could suggest would be to put the readings on the screen in a bright bold red like some of the other advanced rangefinders. This one is in black...it's readable but could be better. Nonetheless its a vast improvement over my 10 year old Bushnell. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Lecocke

customer_reviews.title: Great Value in a Full Function Rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Precision Pro NX7 recently to replace a Bushnell GPS. Really a nice product, works terrific in all conditions. Tested out the slope measurement at a round of StadiumLinks Golf at Citi Field this weekend, and it worked perfect. Highly recommended for function, finish, and value. Seems like a great team at PP too, my friends who have units all said customer service is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: PacoJoe7

customer_reviews.title: Good but get what u pay for
customer_reviews.text: As far as accuracy goes it’s been spot on. Probably one of the cheapest units out there with a slop reading. Compared it to one almost twice the price yard for yard accurate. Not fast at all but does the job finding the pin. A little harder getting reads on bunkers in the fairway. Huge disclaimer and why I lost a star. While playing some how on are 30th hole of 36 of the day the Battery cover came loose fell out the cart. That was not fun to turn around and find witch we did get lucky. I’ll update if that happens again I’ve only had 2 rounds one day so far hopefully that was a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie Warnock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product. Easy to use. Here's a quick tip. The 1st button press (The green Button) only needs to be pressed momentarily. This will turn the unit on and present the cross- hairs. Line up the cross hairs on the target and then press the green button again until a plus sign (+). Then let go of the button after you feel the device vibrate. The accuracy is incredibly precise and reproducible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great bargain and great Rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: I've used this rangefinder for 5 rounds now and I like it a lot. The slope feature works for me on the courses I play on. It focuses well and very accurate for my use. Only issue is, sometimes it won't give me the yardage even after several clicks on one or two holes a round. Not sure why. Can't beat the price. It is light weight and compact so I can put it in my pocket while playing a round. I seldom take my GPS rangefinder with me now.
customer_reviews.author: storm

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Rangefinder except one condition.
customer_reviews.text: You do not know if the product is new or not. when opened box I was not sure if the item was new or not because of the package condition. it is not sealed. everything is just exposed even the box was easy to open. push you thumb and open the box and there is a golf rangefinder with out sealed. it might be republished might be used one. I can see a minor scratch. feels uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: YP

customer_reviews.title: An Accurate Golf rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: A very accurate rangefinder. Just based on my couple of rounds. Accurately locks onto the pin and distance accuracy is great with or without slope. Also love the external form - the protruding green part protects the viewfinder, laser lens and stops you from smudging the lens. Also fits in the hand snugly and has a small form factor compared to others I used in the past. Superb product.
customer_reviews.author: namby

customer_reviews.title: This rangefinder does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this item and took it to the course for the first time today. It worked on the first hole then stopped functioning. I kept trying to use it on each hole but nothing worked. I tried a new battery thinking maybe the battery they sent with the rangefinder was bad but it still would not work. My advice is don’t waste your time or money on this device. It ruined my round continuously trying to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Allen

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money - Broke Within A Few Months
customer_reviews.text: For anyone considering purchase of this device... don't waste your money...purchased one mid-summer 2018 and it broke a week ago... not that I expected Bushnell build quality, but the device just stopped working... dead... and that's about it... sadly the "Product support window closed on Oct 10, 2018"... For the $250 spent... is it even worth taking the time to try and get it replaced... maybe... still I blame myself for having cut cost... rather than just spend the money for considerably better quality... The device should've at least lasted more than a few months... Don't make the same mistake...
customer_reviews.author: djs1138

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy! Cheap & Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for as the old adage goes. This thing does not pick up the flag, the yardages are off and it rarely gives you anything on the slope. I turned the slope mode off hoping that would help the speed and the accuracy but that did not help either. Move on, buy something else!
customer_reviews.author: Nanea

customer_reviews.title: Defective product, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Right from opening the package when I received this NX7, it didn't work. I called twice to customer service and was told they could send me a shipping label and return it so they could look at it and see if it needed replacement. Unfortunately, they did not include the shipping label at that time so I decided to take to the course and see if it would work there. It did finally find one flag for just a moment and then it wouldn't register yardage on anything I shot. Just like when I first received it. I returned it. Very dissatisfied with everything.
customer_reviews.author: donn watrous

customer_reviews.title: small defect and no return call
customer_reviews.text: The product overall works great, but I had a defect in the glass "small dark spot" contacted the company but never received a response.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: Questionable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this range finder for a couple of months now and finally decided to write a review. I like the size of it, but the consistency/accuracy is iffy. On more than one occasion I've shot the flag and come up with wildly inaccurate distances. Example; knowing I am at least 150 based on course yardage markers and come up with 30 some odd yards instead. Another issue I've experienced is having to shoot the flag multiple times to get a reading. I have had other range finders and have never had this much problem. If I could I would send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product, Quality Price, and Customer Service That Sets the Standard in Today’s Society
customer_reviews.text: The Precision Pro Golf NX7 is an excellent rangefinder with slope technology. The NX7 performs as well as other rangefinders in the same category at half the price! The customer service at Precison Pro Golf is above reproach! The free lifetime battery replacement is a small example of the customer care a smaller company can provide to consumers. My son lost his carrying case for his NX7 at his state high school golf championship tournament. I emailed the high school sales rep at Precision Pro to ask him how I could purchase a new case and he sent me one free of charge and free of shipping the same day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s all THAT!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, Rangefinder for the $$$! I was debating getting the Busnell V4 with slope, but at over $400 I couldn’t pull the trigger. I clincher on the NX7 Pro was the combo of slope/no slope, vibrate on target, compact size & 6x magnification:all for $250! Just played with it and felt so much more confident of my club selection, not to mention being able to see my ball after my shot, and before getting in the cart. Oh, and the two year warranty is piece of mind as well.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Slope function definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it 3 times on the 2 courses I play most often. Both of these courses have several greens that are elevated enough that from the fairway you can only see the top half of the flagstick. The slope feature took the guesswork out of club selection. Accuracy seems very close however I have gotten a few weird readings. Looking at backside slope of fairway bunker that was about 200 yards and got 2 readings that said 4.7 yards. Third reading was correct. A buddy of mine has had the non-slope model for 2 years and just replaced the original battery last month. Think I made a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Tex

customer_reviews.title: It works, it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have had this rangefinder since June, 2019. I like it...when it works. It's easy to use and provides accurate readings, when it works. Then, for no apparent reason, I will get a reading of 3.6 yards from wherever I am on the course. Or, it just won't show any yardage. And then 5, 10 minutes later, it will work again, or it won't. This has been going on for the past 3 months. I won't use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Down

customer_reviews.title: NX7 range finders POS.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it was cheaper, we’ll you get what you pay for. Total waste of money. Ranges are all over the place, won’t lock on. You literally have to have a sniper grip on this thing to hold it on the actual flag for 2 seconds at least before it will give you a yardage. 9 out of 10 times it shoots beyond the flat. There’s a circle in the view but that’s for looks. Don’t waste your money. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, hard to lock on pin from 200+ yards.
customer_reviews.text: I've compared it to 4 different Bushnells and its accuracy is within 2 yards every time. The slope feature is great and everything works just as advertised. The only thing I have a problem with is trying to shoot pins that are 200 yards away or over. It takes at least 5-10 tries before I can get the actual yardage of the flag and sometimes I can't get it to lock at all. Other than that its the absolute best range finder for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Hamza Khaliq

customer_reviews.title: Know your distance
customer_reviews.text: Okay I screwed up and bought a cheap model to begin this year lasted just 3 rounds of golf and then quit. I'm very pleased at the quickness and accuracy of this unit and I'm impressed with the warranty and battery replacement program that is offered. I highly recommend this product for your golf game. take strokes off the score card with the right distance and decision of club!
customer_reviews.author: Paul K

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up, So Far So Good!
customer_reviews.text: Price was very good (compared to Bushnell & others); plus you get free replacement batteries (hope this option is never discontinued), a real carrying case and a two year warranty. Company appears to stand behind their product. Works well up to 250 yards, I have no need for greater distances on the golf course to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Martin

customer_reviews.title: This NX7 is truly fantastic. The unit arrived on time and in perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Garmin S1 watch that I thought I had lost so I ordered the NX7 pro. Of course I found the golf watch when the unit arrived. I decided to keep the NX7 and give it a try. Well the watch is not being used anymore. This NX7 is truly fantastic. The unit arrived on time and in perfect working order.,
customer_reviews.author: Hubert

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Great value as well. The vibration function is game changing and not usually available at this price point. Have had it about a year. So far, so good. Would recommend. Someone mentioned that the Momentum Magnetic Wrap does not work with this. This is not true. The wrap covers the mode button, but you can still tap it through the wrap. If put on correctly, the wrap leaves the power and target button accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Deepfreez

customer_reviews.title: 5 yards give or take.
customer_reviews.text: When i compare distances with my fellow golfers, the yardage is always about 5 yds off. It does its job but when comparing with the other brands, its always off it seems. I've learned to live with it as i am not a pro and cant hit perfect yardage like a scratch golfer or pro. The battery needs constant changing though, Its a good thing it comes with a lifetime battery replacement. Order your battery when you get to the half indicator as it seems to die right after a couple rounds after it reaches half for some reason. I wish there was a way to turn off the vibrator, the vibration seems to deplete the battery more rapidly.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Used to have a bulky Bushnell for about 6 years and it was having issues lately. After reading reviews, got the NX7 Pro Slope model. After two weeks. it's super. I play about 4-5 rounds per week, so I don't know how the battery replacement policy will work yet. Don't know if they only allow replacements every 3 months, 4 months, etc. Love the small & accurate features, though. Would definitely recommend this to anyone. It's cheaper, too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Golf rangefinder - light, accurate, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My first rangefinder, am very happy with it. It is light, and is very easy to aim the flag to get accurate readings (2 readings, with and without the slope). The battery is not rechargeable, but that's what makes it lighter than other products and I am totally OK with it. The CR2 battery is lasting longer than I anticipated: already used it for 5 18-hole rounds and still more than 60% (three bars) left. If I can use it for 15 rounds per battery ($1.50 each), I'll be happy about that. Not a bad thing to talk about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Yong S. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and customer support!
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder is great! Quick and accurate. Very clear and crisp to read the yardage. Performs as well as, or better than, more expensive alternatives. The customer support is awesome. I was contacted after registering my product and have the contact info in the event I have an issue or question. I lost the battery cover the other day (user error!) and they immediately shipped me a replacement. This is a very rare combination of a superior product and highest quality customer/product support. Don't even think about -- buy this rangefinder!
customer_reviews.author: Steve C.

customer_reviews.title: Problems from the Start
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rangefinder and there were problems since day 1. Too many times during a round the rangefinder won’t lock on to the flag and it drains the battery continuously trying to get a distance. This summer the rangefinder has been approximately 10 yards off when compared to the other rangefinders or gps devices of friends Ive played with. I would not buy this rangefinder and spend the extra money on a reputable company like Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Locks on Quickly and Very Accurate
customer_reviews.text: My experience has been to lock on quickly to the flag (or whatever i am pinpointing) and is very accurate. For accuracy checks the last month or so has been to compare to the fairway distance markers, partner non-slop adjusted rangefinders, GPS wrist watches, and phone Golf Shot app. The NX7 rangefinder is extremely accurate and repeatable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bret R. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: and this rangefinder is great!! It is compact
customer_reviews.text: I have played 3 rounds so far, and this rangefinder is great!! It is compact, accurate and really easy to use. It is also quick to provide distance, and has a vibrate function when it locks in. Highly Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Drfamulac

customer_reviews.title: Accurate yardage?
customer_reviews.text: There are times/days when I'll get crazy different yardages pinning the same flag! Not finding this product as consistent as other rangefinders. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Tanksy

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, quick, and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: After using this rangefinder for 3 rounds of golf, it has met or exceeded my expectations in all regards. It shoots quickly and accurately and is simple to use. My only negative - and it's a small complaint - is that it is light so there is a little more movement when shooting pins than when using a high end Bushnell. If it weighed a bit more I think it would really help but saving $200 is a nice trade-off as well.
customer_reviews.author: Stryker

customer_reviews.title: I am VERY satisfied with this rangefinder--Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My first impressions were very positive, and after 4-5 months I can confirm that I am extremely satisfied with this purchase. I like the quality and solid feel, how it fits securely in my hand, and how easy it is to get accurate yardages. The slope calculation is great too. I just ordered my first (free) battery replacement from the company. I suspect the battery lasts about 6 months with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory L.

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I had thought about buying a range finder but didn't think my game was good enough. A friend suggested that's why I needed a range finder. After doing lots of research the NX7 seemed to offer the best bang for the buck. I've used it three or four rounds now and it's great. Perfect size, easy to use, and definitely helps to have an exact distance to the pin. Had been using a GPS app on my watch - the NX7 is much more accurate, and always works.I got the slope version which I like. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Quality product at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this rangefinder for 3 yrs now. Although I had a small issue with the first one, Precision Pro replaced it with no hassles. I have recommended this to multiple people who have gone on to purchase it and find it a great working tool. I recently played a course where the carts had GPS that gave you the distance to the pin, with slope. I checked the first few holes to verify the distance with my Precision Pro, and the difference was less than a yard! I'd say that this rangefinder is as accurate as any at twice it's price! Great job Precision Pro!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great multi use tool
customer_reviews.text: It's very light, accurate, and intuitive. Feels good in the hand. Used for golf, recreational target shooting, and home use (fencing, etc.). Feedback gives you confidence in your distances. My golf buddies love borrowing it. I've had zero issues, and would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Flintstone

customer_reviews.title: Accurate when working, but lenses fog up ALL the time rendering it useless.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate when it works, but it fogs up ALL the time and won't work unless I thoroughly wipe the lenses before each use. Very irritating. My golfing buddy has a Bushnell and this never happens to him. I tried to return this one and just bite the bullet and get the Bushnell, but I waited too long and missed the return window by a couple days. 🤬
customer_reviews.author: Beastmaster

customer_reviews.title: ... finder for about a month and I am very happy with the range finder
customer_reviews.text: I have had this range finder for about a month and I am very happy with the range finder. Works great measures just as accurate as the more expensive ones. Very light weight and nice case that came with it. Lifetime supply of batteries are nice as well (just need to pay S&H) Only reason I did not rate this 5 stars is that when it arrived the battery was dead and I had to order another one right away.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Folske

customer_reviews.title: Not off to a good start so far
customer_reviews.text: It did not arrive with batteries. I chose this item on Amazon bc it came with lifetime of free batteries. Not off to a good start so far. Funny too because the box it came in has an “included in the box” and that lists a few things, battery and instruction manual were on this list but neither included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scam
customer_reviews.text: Garbage product. All 5 star reviews when purchased. Yardages are off by a few yards. And it doesn't hit the target. Hundreds of 5 star (Amazon Verified) reviews when I purchased it. Now it's not offered anymore. Another Amazon SCAM.
customer_reviews.author: JKIT

customer_reviews.title: Fits in hand comfortably
customer_reviews.text: This is my third range finder and the best by far! using it for 4 months, almost daily, very accurate including slop readings! Free battery replacements add extra value as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ray R.

customer_reviews.title: Read before
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews on Amazon as well as leading golf publications on this product before purchasing this unit and returned it after only trying to use it on 3 holes. Main problem was the clarity of the scope. The eye piece is smaller than my current older Bushnell making it difficult to find the target and reading the yardage numbers. Accuracy was a challenge as I used both my old unit and this product to compare yardages.
customer_reviews.author: Bel Air, MD golfer

customer_reviews.title: Money Well Spent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I was ready for a new laser rangefinder. After using it for three rounds, I can say it works every bit as good as the more expensive rangefinders. Push the green button once to turn it on, center the pin in the circle and push the green button again and release it. the Precision Pro NX7 will give you the distance and you are good to go. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: T. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This is the first rangefinder I've ever owned, but it seems really accurate and is definitely worth the investment. It seems very accurate. I had a couple of misreads the first time I used it, but that was probably user error. Now it seems to be spot on every time. I know there are more expensive models, but I'm not sure what else would be needed. Definitely helps my game. Wish I bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble getting this to "lock on" to the pin- often takes me 5 or 6 attempts. I will continuously get readings of 7 or 8 yards on par 3s. It is an OK rangefinder- I am not good enough to worry over a few yards difference, but it is certainly not worthy of more than 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: M. Patton

customer_reviews.title: Tried it twice, never worked
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back, never got it to work. Perhaps mine was not calibrated. Two times on a course and changed batteries, tried everything to make it work. Returned it, got the Bushnell Slope V4 Tour, worked instantly. Really wanted this to work. The clarity and jolt are not even close IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: User friendly/Clarity
customer_reviews.text: Im so exited when I received my order NX7 pro Rangefinder. I follow step by step procedure ,very easy and user friendly. I own deff.expensive rangefinder only for hunting use .This is the 1st time I purchase for golf use.For my surprise is how this product built (impact and lightweight) .The Clarity of the lense is excellent ,that you only find this quality on A very expensive Unit but the price is way down compare to the top of the line veryexpensive product.I will enjoy this for years to come and I highly recommend this to everyone who wants to own good quality Rangefinder.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Zonio

customer_reviews.title: Better than my old Bushnell
customer_reviews.text: I had a Bushnell range finder for a few years and it became wildly inaccurate. According to Bushnell it could not be repaired. Rather than spend another five hundred plus dollars on another one I decided to try something else. This has better optics, slope and is accurate to the half yard. If it lasts longer than the way more expensive Bushnell, I'll call it a win.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought New, Received Used
customer_reviews.text: Compact design, quick vibration follows lock onto pin. Accuracy is questionable since the returned yardage differs when measuring the same pin twice from standing on one spot. I purchased a NEW unit, but the one I received was either a restocked or refurbished one. It already had a few scratches and smudges as if someone tried to wipe it with fingers. I'll give the unit more try on the field, but the seller is a real disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: kuku5158

customer_reviews.title: A solid rangefinder for the price! Only played 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: A solid rangefinder for the price! Only played 2 rounds with it and no issues. Rangfinder is extremely light and the lime green color really stands out. Everyone wants to know what brand it is. I noticed a couple times that it would detect an object behind the target but it most likely caused by a shaky hand. Buy this thing and improve your game!
customer_reviews.author: Drock

customer_reviews.title: My Son Loves His Rangefinder!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son who has found a new love in golf. He absolutely loves this rangefinder. He likes the accuracy of it and has said that his game has improved since using it. He would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: gabs

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This product was ready to use right out of the box. Very easy to use. Our course no longer uses red, white and blue flags to designate front, middle, back. Only use one color. I researched rangefinders and this one had good reviews. I like that I can switch between regular range for tournament play and slope when I am just playing with friends. Will never have to buy a replacement battery as, once registered, batteries are free for life.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Ordered and Received the SAME DAY!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrific! I had just lost my old Bushnell and I ordered this. I received it the same day!! How excellent is that?! It was an upgrade because of the slope feature. It really made a difference on the course. I sincerely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Autumngirl

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Rangefinder performs flawlessly - quickly and accurately calculates the distance, and locks it in with a vibration so you know you've got the final distance. Lightweight, sturdy carrying case and strap to hang on my golf bag. Definitely recommend this - outstanding value.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Glasses don't work well with eyepiece
customer_reviews.text: My nearly 20 year old rangefinder finally bit the dust. I purchased this one and it is much smaller and works very well! It does not work well with my eyeglasses but the eye piece is adjustable and I can make it work. It is MUCH better taking the glasses off and using it. So far it is very accurate and easy to use. I would absolutely say it's worth the price and a great product to purchase. I'm not sure why my old one was no issue with glasses, but that's my only concern with this one and it's only a slight concern.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy and Ease of Use
customer_reviews.text: This range finder has performed as advertised. I compared the readings to my friends ranger finders and against my golf GPS app on my phone. The unit is very simple to use and it acquires the target quickly. I would recommend this range finder to anyone looking to purchase a solid, mid-priced, quality unit. You could spend much more but this unit is as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Fields

customer_reviews.title: A Lot More Bang For the Buck!
customer_reviews.text: My Bushnell rangefinder was outdated and I needed an upgrade. I had looked into the Precision Pro but wasn't sure about it. I was out at a local retailer anf spotted the NX7 in the display case. One try and I was sold. Same functions and quality as Bushnell at a much lower price. I highly recommend this device over a Bushnell any day
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Simple on and target. Auto off. Great storage case
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. No trouble finding targets (even yellow) compared distances side by side with other brands. Only a few feet difference. Love the storage case with zipper and quick close bungee for while you are playing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product and value
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder works great. It locates the pin quickly by just swiping the crosshairs over the pin back and forth. Slope and normal mode are both awesome. For the price, with battery replacements, you cannot beat this product.
customer_reviews.author: K.C. McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with good distance accuracy
customer_reviews.text: After many, many years of golf I finally decided to get a rangefinder. I did a lot of research and bought the Precision Pro NX7. It is easy to use and gives quick, accurate yardage readings. I do not have the steadiest hands but the PP NX7 still works well for me. The only issue I have experienced is at twilight it does not always pick up the target from 200+ yards. This is not a big deal for me and I would make the same decision to purchase this rangefinder. Thanks Precision Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Durability Issues
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this rangefinder for 2 years now and it’s worked well until yesterday. I left the pouch unzipped and a few drops of rain got on the unit... it’s now dead. I loved this product for its value - but it’s durability needs work.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Never had a problem until my last round. It was overcast conditions and my rangefinder would not pick up any target I tried. I would keep giving me under 6 yards for every target I tried. My friend has a Buschnell and never had a problem. So I’ll give it one more try tomorrow, if it doesn’t work, I will be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Stoltenberg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Rangefinder!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rangefinder, as I've never wanted to spend $400 on one. I've always used GPS to get close, but the exact distance has really improved my game. The rangefinder is easy to use and locks on the target very quickly. The slope feature is also nice to have as a reference. Size is great and fits in one of my pockets well. Lens is recessed so it doesn't get scratched. Customer service is also great. I had a question about the rebate and I immediately got an answer. I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory G.

customer_reviews.title: Best slope rangefinder you can own
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a new rangefinder that has slope for a couple years now. I was always looking at the Bushnell, but didn't want to spend the money. I have seen the Precision pro a couple times in ads. I bought it and have used it for 5 rounds of golf. it is GREAT !!!! does exactly what I want. very easy to use. its very light and small. definitely worth the money. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Seriously give this a try you won’t regret it.  2nd Season and I still love this rangefinder!
customer_reviews.text: A number of years ago I had a Bushnell RF which I used a few times before selling on eBay. Instead I elected to use an iPhone app which I still use for scoring and blind shot distances. I find the NX7 extremely easy to use it almost always locks in on the first try. I rarely write reviews unless a product is a star or a dud. THIS IS A STAR!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wachtel

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend the NX7
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, accurate and perfect size. I have been using a yardage watch for a couple years now. I was hesitant to go to the laser range finder, but I’m glad I did. The NX7 has helped my game more than I can say.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Extremely hard to lock onto Flag stick
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and ease of the finder, however locking onto the pin at any distance was extremely hard and at that would give me inaccurate readings. I golf with 3 other guys every Friday and they all have Bushnell range finders that would lock and give an accurate reading and I would compare what mine was saying to there's and it would always be 30-100 yards inaccurate and that's no exaggeration. I'm hoping it was just a defect in the one I got as it seems others have not had the issues I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Donaghy

customer_reviews.title: I initially had problems with this range finder. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I initially had problems with this range finder. I called the company's tech assistance line. They immediately replaced my range finder with a brand new one. This one works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: MJD

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit my golf game.
customer_reviews.text: It was very hard for me to keep it steady enough to get an accurate yardage. I found that a simple golf app on my cell phone worked just as well. I actually returned it after 2 rounds of golf.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Earl

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Severely Lacking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Precision Pro less than a month ago, and the battery case already fell off the unit. It has stayed clipped to my bag, only off to measure distances, but somehow the clip that holds the battery in fell off. Reached out to Support 48 hours ago about a replacement, with no response. At this point I just want them to refund so I can go buy a Bushnell, but not holding my breath I will hear from them. I guess I will enjoy my $200+ Paper Weight, as I cannot use the unit without it.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Value
customer_reviews.text: Have shot with this vs expensive Bushnell and its right on the money at half the price. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: matthew m

customer_reviews.title: Worked 70% of the time but will try a replacement. Report coming soon.
customer_reviews.text: My first week, the rangefinder worked 70% of the time. 30% of the time you would push the button on and no marking at all. Or You would get markings but no distance. Very frustrating. I returned it and replaced it. I’ll write another review after I test it on the course.
customer_reviews.author: James Motta

customer_reviews.title: very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Torrey Pines is my home course, which is a longe course and the yardarge books were not cutting it as my game got better. This was my first range finder and i didnt want to spend $400+ on a Bushnell. I was a little skeptical since i had never heard of this brand, but after reading all the reviews i went for it. I have had it for 6 months, best investment i have made (aside from clubs) for my game. battery is at 2/3 % after ~30 rounds. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Hulbert

customer_reviews.title: Makes hubby very happy!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is that husband loves this! Got it for him as birthday gift and I have never seen him so excited. He quickly tested it out on the course and says it works great! I don’t know what makes it work but it makes hubby very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just wish I would've waited a week when the price dropped by $40
customer_reviews.text: Great choice over the more expensive Bushnell. I've used it for two rounds now and it's changed my game, mentally at least.
customer_reviews.author: Bob O

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and quick to lock in to a distance
customer_reviews.text: I play mostly on a hilly course and I love the NX7 Pro because it is so easy to use and locks in to the flag distance with eaze, even if you don't have the most steady hands. Very accurate distance, and I love the adjusted distance to offset the slope. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Emil Chuang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rangefinder for my son for his birthday and he loves is and gives it a solid 5 star rating. I have another brand of range finder, which son borrowed from me occasionally, but he likes the Precision NX7 better. It vibrates when you hit the target you are shooting at and it is compact and easy to put in your pocket. Great rangefinder!
customer_reviews.author: Ron B.

customer_reviews.title: I have found this tool very useful not only on approach but during practice and warmup
customer_reviews.text: First rangefinder for me, handicap 11. I have found this tool very useful not only on approach but during practice and warmup. Discovered club distance varies almost daily. May be the first time I can accurately choose club. Highly recommend this product. By the way, turned 65 in June, old dog with a new trick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as reliable as the others I've had
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it doesn't lock onto the pin as easily as others I've used like Bushnell. You have to hit it 2 or 3 times to be sure of the number.
customer_reviews.author: M. Atwell

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a rangefinder with slope capabilities and name brand Bushnell was twice as much as these and this does the same exact thing for half the price! My husband is very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lori86

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the equivalents but at nearly half the cost
customer_reviews.text: Been using this rangefinder now for over 3 months. I've compared this unit with other more expensive range finders as I golf with with my golf buddies. This unit is typically not only faster, but just as accurate as the others with similar features like slope compensation option. Soo far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Studio1

customer_reviews.title: This item is awesome. Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This item is awesome. Very pleased. Works consistently out to 300 yards and rarely do I have any issue getting readings at that distance. Very pleased with this product. Half the price of the big boys and works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks B.

customer_reviews.title: Need more work
customer_reviews.text: Overall this rangefinder is average. There has been several times where I knew I was out 160 yards from the pin and the rangefinder was giving me a reading of 85 yards.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Love This Rangefinder!! Replaced My Bushnell!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of this rangefinder so far. Used it half a dozen rounds so far and I am impressed. I was coming off a Bushnell rangefinder that I had been using for years that eventually quit finding the flags. This rangefinder does a fantastic job of giving me the distance and slope. I have never had an issue (so far) of picking up a pin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rangefinder!!
customer_reviews.text: This range finder is so much easier to use than the more expensive one I had before. The size is perfect and it works like a charm. The slope and pulse vibration are a really nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Very accurate and really like the slope feature! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce K. Chatterton

customer_reviews.title: gift for husband’s father’s day
customer_reviews.text: he loves it!! his first time out with it, he shot an 85 (usually in low to mid 90s). very easy to use & accurate. I didn’t put a rating on accuracy bc i’m not sure, he hasn’t mentioned but I know it’s definitely helped his game. also told a colleague about it and he got one for himself & his dad. they both love it too!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Donnamiller

customer_reviews.title: Great golf rangefinder!
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder works as advertised. And the price? It is such a good deal for what you get. The unit feels solidly built and the optics are just fine to me. Already have 3 rounds with it and no more yardage guessing.
customer_reviews.author: Clint-10

customer_reviews.title: accurate and fast
customer_reviews.text: picks up the pin fast almost all the time. very accurate against more expensive bushnells. only dislikes are , it wont work with any kind of fog and sometimes i cant read bunkers and objects other than pins. very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had a very nice feel and the magnification was great
customer_reviews.text: Had a very nice feel and the magnification was great. However, the yardages were off 3-5 yards compared to my old GPS, the GPS on the carts at my club, and other rangefinders on the days I tried it. I returned it and purchased a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Stowers Jr.

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is a good buy
customer_reviews.text: It some times picks up back ground instead of the flag stick. Red sights would be much easier to see instead of the black
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Herd

customer_reviews.title: Different but in a good way!
customer_reviews.text: To echo some of the other reviews, I also had a Bushnell rangefinder and tried using this one the same way. Initially I thought it was defective!!, however once I realized how to operate it I am thrilled with its speed of use and accuracy! Love also it's light weight and of course the ability to use the slope feature when I want. Overall would definitely recommend this product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A.

product_meta.title: Precision Pro Golf, NX7 Pro Slope Golf Rangefinder, Laser Range Finder with Pulse Vibration, 400 Yard Range, 6X Magnification, Flag Lock, Slope Measurement, Battery Replacement
feature_bullets: PRO SLOPE GOLF RANGEFINDER: The Precision Pro Golf NX7 Pro Slope has been engineered to provide accurate distances on sloped or flat surfaces. Our Pro Slope technology makes it user friendly and helps you select the correct golf club.

ADAPTIVE SLOPE TECHNOLOGY: Our NX7 Pro Slope golf laser rangefinder is infused with Pro Slope technology that provides a “play as” distance to make club selection simple. The slope function can be easily turned off for legal tournament play.

CLEAR, QUICK, PRECISE: Built with crystal clear optics, 6X magnification, and precise technology, the NX7 Pro Slope Golf Rangefinder produces quick yardage of a golf ball’s distance to the hole and is easy to use, even for golfers with shaky hands.

400 YARD RANGE: This golf rangefinder has a 400-yard range capacity, is water-resistant, displays 1/10-yard measurements, and can be set for meters or yards. It is accurate to one yard and delivers a short vibration when you shoot the target.

FREE LIFETIME BATTERY REPLACEMENT: This golf rangefinder comes with lifetime battery replacement services with product registration. The care package also includes a 2-year warranty, trade-in allowance, industry-leading support, and much more.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
